intro: Cupania glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth cupania, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. It produces smooth, elongated fruits that contain several seeds. Cupania glaberrima is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
